body_html:
Alternatively, you can always define the metrics within a name scope and only reset the local variables within that name scope.
…
On Fri, Jun 2, 2017 at 11:01 AM, Amirsina Torfi ***@***.***> wrote: Thank you @nathansilberman <https://github.com/nathansilberman> . Unfortunately it didn't work. Looks like the supervisor is much smarter than that! Moreover I the the problem with tf.local_variables_initializer() is that by defining the reset_op it may reset all variables. I am not %100 sure though. But thank you so much for the hint. I think I may find the solution from this. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body_text:
Alternatively, you can always define the metrics within a name scope and
only reset the local variables within that name scope.
…

 Moreover I the the problem with tf.local_variables_initializer() is that
 by defining the reset_op it may reset all variables.

body:
Alternatively, you can always define the metrics within a name scope and
only reset the local variables within that name scope.

On Fri, Jun 2, 2017 at 11:01 AM, Amirsina Torfi <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I am not %100 sure though.
